definitions.text: free from liquid or moisture; lacking natural or normal moisture or depleted of water; or no longer wet

examples: an ironic remark often conveys an intended meaning obliquely

definitions.text: opposed to or prohibiting the production and sale of alcoholic beverages
examples: the dry vote led by preachers and bootleggers

definitions.text: (of liquor) having a low residual sugar content because of decomposition of sugar during fermentation
without a mucous or watery discharge
examples: that rare thing in the wintertime; a small child with a dry nose

definitions.text: lacking interest or stimulation; dull and lifeless; ; ; - John Mason Brown
examples: a dry lecture filled with trivial details
dull and juiceless as only book knowledge can be when it is unrelated to...life

definitions.text: used of solid substances in contrast with liquid ones
unproductive especially of the expected results
examples: a mind dry of new ideas
rattled off the facts in a dry mechanical manner

definitions.text: (of food) eaten without a spread or sauce or other garnish
having a large proportion of strong liquor
examples: a very dry martini is almost straight gin
a dry reading of the lines

definitions.text: practicing complete abstinence from alcoholic beverages
examples: he's been dry for ten years
no thank you; I happen to be teetotal
